Choices:  A: learn more about B: headache C: do math D: enlightened E: better understanding<n>Answer: E: better understanding<n><n>Input: I needed to find out how to contact a person with a certain name, where should I look? Choices:  A: directory B: michigan C: roster D: phone book E: certificate<n>Answer: D: phone book<n><n>### Input:The man needed to buy flooring, where was he looking for it? Choices:  A: walmart B: loft C: house D: home depot E: kitchen<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>Directions: Select the letter of the choice that describes what you can deduce from the input. If no letter answer is listed, go to next question.<n><n>Response: A<n><n>Response: B<n><n>Response: C<n><n>Response: D<n><n>### Summary:<n><n>### Output:<n><n>### Challenge:Create a set of conditional logic that can select the proper answer for the questions.<n><n>### Challenge2:What if more than one answer is possible?<n><n>The answer to the questions is always a letter based on what is shown in the input. You will need a way to determine which answer is available. Once you determine the answer, output it based on the letter from the input. You will find this information in the question.<n><n>## Contest:<n>No<n>

Choices: .A: I'd be glad to B: yes, thank you C: I would rather not D: my pleasure E: sure, not a problem<n>Answer:C: I would rather not<n><n>Input: What was the cause of her illness?  What did the doctor determine? Choices:  a: food poisoning b: stomach flue c: stomach ulcer d: heart attack e: viral gastroenteritis<n><n>Input:What is the difference between an ECG and an EKG? Choices:.A: the number of Ks B: an initial consultation C: an electrocardiogram D: a patient record E: the number of letters<n><n><n><n>	---<n>	#### Task:		<n>	<n><n>		Write a function to return the appropriate response to an input.<n>	<n>		Input: a boolean argument, the return value will be one of the multiple choice options that corresponds to the input argument.<n>			Example.<n><n>			boolean input = false;<n>			char[] inputArray = { 'A','B', 'D'};<n>			<n>			MultipleChoice(input, inputArray);<n>			<n><n>		Output:  print the multiple choice response which corresponds to the input.<n>		  <n>	---<n><n>	-<n>	 <n>	Input: A string of up to 10 elements<n>		<n>	For example:	<n>		"A"<n>		"B"<n>		"D"<n>		...<n>		<n>	char[] inputArray;<n>	<n>	char: is a value that comes from a string, or it might stand in as one string.<n>		<n>	<n>	---<n>	<n>	<n>	Output:<n>		<n>		char answer = multipleChoice(boolean input, char[] inputArray);<n>	<n>	answer will be from the multiple choice response set.<n>	<n>	For example : 	<n>		<n>	If 	boolean = true<n>		then<n>		answer will be	D.<n>		<n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The lab results had been compiled, the scientist began analysing the data because he wanted what? Choices:  A: learn more about B: headache C: do math D: enlightened E: better understanding<n>Answer: E: better understanding<n><n>Input: I needed to find out how to contact a person with a certain name, where should I look? Choices:  A: directory B: michigan C: roster D: phone book E: certificate<n>Answer: D: phone book<n><n>### Input:What type of person typically contracts illness? Choices:  A: hospital B: head C: sick person D: elderly person E: doctor's office<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>I wanted to make sure we have the same answer, because I never heard from you on the question, so I wanted to let you know what my answer was.<n><n>A: A phone book is a book of directory in the United States of America. When we had to contact you (by phone) and I needed your phone number, I looked in your phone book. The phone number was (305)287-0907. Your address was in Miami, Florida (city in the United States).<n><n>### Input/response:<n><n>Better way to do this:<n><n>A: A directory is a book that makes people easy to find or identify. The directories contain alphabetical list of the names of the persons, companies, place, the organisations etc. The directory makes people easy to find. This can be useful if you call the phone.<n><n>B: It is called michigan because Michigan is the name of a country in America. Its capital is Mumbai.<n><n>C: When I had a job, some of my colleagues and I used to exchange our telephone numbers so that we could contact each other any time if we needed to.<n><n>D: Some young children like to help parents in the kitchen because they can bake with a parent’s supervision.<n><n>E: A person who is sick or has experienced health issues may need to see a doctor or go to a hospital when she or he needs medical attention to become healthy again.<n><n>A phone book is a phone directory. When I was in Nigeria, Nigeria had a phone book. A phone book is a directory that contains the list of people who are in your area. When you do not know the name of a person, you can look at the phone book to know because the phone book is there for you and others to see the list.<n><n>A: The answer to this question is A. The phone number that you need to call is (305) 287-0207.<n><n>When I was young, I used to have to look in the phone book to find a person's number. When I was growing up we lived in New York and my father loved to hire foreign workers from other countries in the world. One day his manager had the idea of helping us hire a house keeper. So, the boss called the phone book and got our address, home phone

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The lab results had been compiled, the scientist began analysing the data because he wanted what? Choices:  A: learn more about B: headache C: do math D: enlightened E: better understanding<n>Answer: E: better understanding<n><n>Input: I needed to find out how to contact a person with a certain name, where should I look? Choices:  A: directory B: michigan C: roster D: phone book E: certificate<n>Answer: D: phone book<n><n>### Input:Where would you find a seafood restaurant in the east coast of North America? Choices:  A: maine B: boston C: beach town D: coastal cities E: ocean<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>#### Part 3<n>Input: An architect is trying to find a company that sells building materials, who should they contact? Choices: <n>A: The people who built the building.<n>B: The building manager.<n>C: The building owners.<n>D: The builders who did the electrical, carpentry, and plumbing on the building.<n>E: The people who managed the project.<n><n>Answer: A: The people who built that building.<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The lab results had been compiled, the scientist began analysing the data because he wanted what? Choices:  A: learn more about B: headache C: do math D: enlightened E: better understanding<n>Answer: E: better understanding<n><n>Input: I needed to find out how to contact a person with a certain name, where should I look? Choices:  A: directory B: michigan C: roster D: phone book E: certificate<n>Answer: D: phone book<n><n>### Input:The game promised it was free, but the child's parents soon found themselves doing what for microtransactions? Choices:  A: costly B: captive C: contained D: paying E: caught<n><n>### Response:		Choices should fit each other; for example<n><n> - A should be D; A is not free and needs to cost more than zero.<n> - E should be D; E is not microtransaction and does not ask for money. `captive` and `contained` are not relevant to the question<n> - B,C and E cannot be combined at all, as paying and containing do not make sense<n> - B and E should both be `costly`.<n><n>Response: Paying more for a freindly game; the question is about the parent being charged money and the child playing.<n><n>It should be free. When the game has to cost money, the child is not playing. It is only a question about game mechanics, not a microtransaction.<n><n>```javascript<n>const getInstruction = () => {<n>  const instruction = Array.from(document.querySelectorAll("div.instruction"))[0]<n>  const response = Array.from(instruction.querySelectorAll("div"))[1];<n>  const answer = [...instruction.querySelectorAll(".answer")[0].innerHTML].join("  ");<n>  const choices = Array.from(answer.split(" ")).filter(i =>!i.includes("CORRECT"));<n>  return choices.map(<n>    i => (<n>      <div key={i}><n>        {i}<n>        {!i.includes("C")<n>         ? <span className='wrong'></span><n>          : <span className='correct'></span><n>        }<n>      </div><n>    )<n>  );<n>};<n><n>const renderAnswer = (answers) => {<n>  for (let item of answers) {<n>    item.classList.add("item");<n>  }<n>  return answers;<n>};<n><n>console.log(getInstruction());<n><n>renderAnswer(getInstruction()); ```<n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Choices:  A: learn more about B: headache C: do math D: enlightened E: better understanding<n>Answer: E: better understanding<n><n>Input: I needed to find out how to contact a person with a certain name, where should I look? Choices:  A: florida B: denmark C: united states D: map E: california<n><n>### Response:		<n>A directory is a listing of the names and telephone numbers of people or organisations in a particular place.<n><n>This is what we are looking for:<n><n>[Directory](https://wikipedia.org/wiki/Directory_(computer_science))<n><n>A directory (also known as telephone directory or phone book) is a collection of addresses or information about people, places, or things. They are usually organised alphabetically.<n><n><n>- In computing, a directory is a file system structure that contains an organized listing of directories (or directories and files) and the type and size of each file.<n><n><n>The following is an example of a phone book.<n><n>![](./images/phonebook.png)<n><n><a href="https://wikipedia.org"><n>Wikipedia<n></a><n><n>|<n><n>|

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The lab results had been compiled, the scientist began analysing the data because he wanted what? Choices:  A: learn more about B: headache C: do math D: enlightened E: better understanding<n>Answer: E: better understanding<n><n>Input: I needed to find out how to contact a person with a certain name, where should I look? Choices:  A: directory B: michigan C: roster D: phone book E: certificate<n>Answer: D: phone book<n><n>### Input:If an animal is tired, what is it likely to do? Choices:  A: bite B: lie down C: keep alive D: need to eat E: go to sleep<n><n>### Response:		<n>#### <n>```python<n>from selenium import webdriver<n><n>driver = webdriver.Chrome()<n>driver.get('https://google.com')<n>searchTerm = driver.find_element_by_name('q')<n>searchTerm.send_keys('python')<n>searchTerm.submit()<n>searchResults = ''<n>while searchResults == '':<n>    searchResults = driver.find_elements_by_class_name('r')<n><n>for each_result in searchResults:<n>    print(each_result.text)<n>```<n><n>#### Output<n>```python<n>hello<n>hello<n>hello<n>```<n><n>#### <n>```ruby<n>puts "hi"<n>```<n><n>#### Outcome:<n>```<n><n>```<n><n>####<n>```perl<n>print "hello";<n>```<n><n>####Outlook:<n>```<n>hi<n><n>```<n><n>## Solution<n>#### Question:<n>For the below example, "The question" represents the instruction. The response is the code that follows it.<n>Input: The question<n>#### Answer:<n>The question was "Which country would you like to visit based on the options below?".<n><n>Response:<n>A. France<n>    B. Spain<n>    C. Italy<n>    D. Mexico<n>    E. Argentina<n><n>#### Result:<n>Outcome:<n>France<n><n>## How to Contribute<n><n>1. Fork or cloning the repo.<n><n>2. Add your response into the `./examples` folder.<n><n>3. Run the tests to make sure everything still works.<n><n>4. Create a Pull Request.<n>

Those are all included in the term "utilities". So if you are writing a list of these things, these are some examples.<n><n>- Option6: The clothing<n><n>The clothing can include things like pajamas, underwear, socks, shoes and coats. Clothing is a huge category<n><n>### Answer<n>The answer is: The gas purchases<n><n>### Input The boss had decided to buy 10 new computers for his company, he expected his employees to do the work that requires a large amount of computer memory. Choices:  A: learn more about B: headache C: do math D: enlightened E: better understanding<n>Answer: E: better understanding<n><n>Input: I needed to find out how to contact a person with a certain name, where should I look? Choices:  A: directory B: michigan C: roster D: phone book E: certificate<n>Answer: D: phone book<n><n>### Input:What would an adult man do to get ready for work? Choices:  A: dress herself B: shower C: dress himself D: drink beer E: drive train<n><n>### Response:		The options provided are incorrect. First, an adult man does not shower. When the person is a toddler, he/she would shower. Second, an adult man would not be driving a train. When the person is an auto mechanic, he/she is a “train driver” of mechanical things, which is not correct for the job at hand which is not related to that. Third, an adult man does drive himself to work.<n>### Input:A man named Michael works in a bank. When he got to Starbucks the price for that drink was $2.25, which he didn’t have. He tried to spend whatever he could on that drink, and he used his bank card to make up the rest, but Paul’s drink was not included in the $19.99 Starbucks card. What should Michael tell Paul? Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The lab results had been compiled, the scientist began analysing the data because he wanted what? Choices:  A: learn more about B: headache C: do math D: enlightened E: better understanding<n>Answer: E: better understanding<n><n>Input: I needed to find out how to contact a person with a certain name, where should I look? Choices:  A: directory B: michigan C: roster D: phone book E: certificate<n>Answer: D: phone book<n><n>### Input:Where can someone keep a digital file? Choices:  A: suitcase B: filing cabinet C: computer D: desk drawer E: cloud<n><n>### Response:		<n>The response should be in the correct form you have been given in the instruction. The answer can either be multiple select or single select. <n><n>### Input Format:<n>This will be an input question.<n><n>## Input:<n>This will be a collection of inputs that the user has to respond to and will be a single select question.<n><n>## Output:<n>You will either be given a result from a number of choices, or you will be asked to provide an answer with some instructions.<n><n>### Example:<n>![Sandbox Example][image]<n><n>### Input Example:<n>![SandBox Example][image2]<n><n>### Output Example:<n>![Sandra Example][image3]<n><n>### Question:<n>What can this component do for you?<n>- Use a single answer response for quizzes<n>- Automatically detects when a single select input is finished<n>- Doesn't take any input from the user<n>- Automatically detect single answer responses from inputs you provide<n><n>## Limitations:<n><n>- The following question:<n>- Can't be answered by multiple users simultaneously<n>- There is a bug in the sandbox where inputs aren't counted correctly<n>- The following question is a single select question where multiple answer choices can be used instead of single choice<n><n>## Contributions:<n><n>Contributions are appreciated, you don't have to be a code expert, just an interested community member who is willing to<n>improve the documentation.<n><n>Your contributions are welcome! Please make a simple Pull Request. If you want more information, please see the next step.<n><n>## How to Contribute?:<n><n>You already know how to contribute by:<n><n>- [Fork](https://help.github.com/articles/fork-a-repo/) the repo.<n><n>- Clone the repo to your machine:<n><n>```<n>// Clone the repo<n>git clone git@github.com:mynamehere/component-guides-examples-documentation.git<n><n>// Go into the directory you just cloned.<n>```<n>- Run `npm install` to update package dependencies.<n><n>```<n>// Install packages locally<n>cd components/guides<n>npm install<n><n>// Install packages globally<n>npm install -g<n>```<n>- Go into the directory of the component where you made the modification that you want to contribute.<n>

I like reading fiction because it gives me time to escape into a fantasy world or read about someone else's fictional experience. It also allows you to explore a topic from a different angle to make it fresh. <n><n>### Input :i have been thinking about whether to get my son to read more books and see if he likes reading Choices:  A Yes No C: Yes E: No<n><n>### Response :<n>Yes, reading is a great way to improve your brain health. It is associated with better memory and learning ability, higher comprehension of the world, more creativity and imagination, and less stress or depression.  If you are interested in teaching your son to read, then try using "The Five Paragraphs Reading Formula," which involves learning the five most common words used in the English language.<n><n>Thank you for your input and I hope we can assist you with this question. Please, let us know if you have any further questions or concerns. <n><n>## Question<n><n>### Input<n>I want to purchase a new shaver, i don't know if my money can  be enough to get me a decent razor<n><n>### Response<n><n>I'm sorry to hear that you're struggling to find a shaver. For example, the Philips PowerSonicFast is a great shaver.<n><n>Best of luck with your search<n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. In essence, you should give a scenario that describes your task, and then explain what you did, why you did it, and what were the possible results. For example, a text entry task might be: "I was asked to transcribe this text, so that I could add some metadata to it." Write as much information as possible. As you get more experience with your task, your first descriptions will become more concise without losing information.<n><n>### Task: How to create a new user and a new role in RACI?<n><n>### Demomstration<n><n>A new user 'Gloria' with password '123' and 1 role named 'roles' is needed.   <n><n>'Gloria' with  '123' password with 1 role is created.<n><n>### Description<n><n>You need to describe what is to be accomplished in terms of what you are trying to do, and why. In other words, in the scenario above, you could say, "I need to create a new user with a login of 'Gloria' and password of '123'. The user 'Gloria'' needs a 1 role with the name 'roles'.<n><n>In the instructions written above, that is what's expected of

I explained to him that I had bought some food and I wanted to get it home. I showed him my certificate and he helped me put the goods on wheels.<n><n>------------------ > (C) It took a while to go to the refrigerator and all the goods stayed cold. Some of the good didn't arrive.<n><n>--------------------- > (D) The food was then put on a lorry, and it was taken home and I waited many days.<n>```typescript<n>/**<n> * Write the value of your function to the console.<n> * @memberof Lab<n> */<n>public results:any;<n>```
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The lab results had been compiled, the scientist began analysing the data because he wanted what? Choices:  A: learn more about B: headache C: do math D: enlightened E: better understanding<n>Answer: E: better understanding<n><n>Input: I needed to find out how to contact a person with a certain name, where should I look? Choices:  A: directory B: michigan C: roster D: phone book E: certificate<n>Answer: D: phone book<n><n>### Input:An attempt to confirm an applicant's reference would fail if the reference does what? Choices:  A: question B: dispute C: deny D: contradict E: refuse<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>```<n>$ python code.py <n>"name" "number" <n>```<n><n>### Input<n><n>```<n>"I need a bite to eat"<n>"I'll bake something"<n>```<n><n>## Demo<n><n>**code.py**<n>```python<n>import re<n>import jieba<n>nv = input()<n>num = input()<n>if nv!= num:<n>    print("please give two same names");<n>else:<n>    jieba.load_userdict(u'resources/dict_for_user.txt')<n>    f = jieba.SentenceSegmenter(vocab=jieba.vocab)<n>    x = f.cut(nv + " " + num)<n>    if len(x) == 2:<n>        print(x)<n>```<n><n>**resources/dict_for.txt**<n>```<n>张三张四<n>张三張四<n>三七六<n>1376<n>...<n>```<n><n>```<n>"Please try this method"<n>    ```<n><n>Please use this instruction for your practice<n>[![Binder](https://mybinder.org/badge_logo.png)](http://mybinder.julia-lang.org/v2/gh/yushui-meng/python_101/HEAD?urlpath=lab/01-%20Parsing%20a%20Text%20To%20Get%20Only%20a%3A%20Names)<n>

Choices:  A: feeling refreshed B: becoming tired C: restlessness D: leg cramps E: sweating<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>To answer the following question, write the number that best corresponds to the question of interest in the first line of your response, followed by a single line of prose describing the answer.<n><n>Please answer the following multiple choice question and provide the number that best corresponds in the prompt.  <n>What happens when you take an shower after going for  a  run?<n><n>Answer: <n><n>You feel refreshed.<n><n>The first line of the response, called a 'header', should be a single numeric value (1 to 4) that corresponds to an answer to one of the previous questions about a certain task. The second line should contain a one-liner justifying the answer to the previous question.<n><n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Reference:<n>Input: How do you check the time? The prompt after the second dash is the question we ask.<n><n>In response to a question, write up to three lines of prose in which you describe your answer/explanation with an uppercase letter.<n><n>Write an answer to the following question.<n><n>#### Question: <n>I needed to find out how  a to contact a person  with a certain name. <n>Where should I look?<n><n>#### Answer: <n>(B) phone book<n><n>Answer:<n><n>Sometimes we might have questions about how the program works, or what is happening during the completion of a task, or we may just want to know more about the data or the input values. When we ask a question, they use the prompt, which begins with two dashes (-–) and ends in parentheses. The prompt after dash 1 is the the question we ask. <n><n>#### Question

The book has 211 pages. The book contains 150 pages (pages that is), but what must be added in order to arrive at the actual number of pages in the book? Answer: 211, she should have subtracted the number of pages.<n>### Response 2: 100%, She is 150 pages behind.<n><n>### A friend of mine was interested in a good way to memorize new vocabulary when he was doing advanced German language. The friend found a good list of vocabulary words on the Internet. Here is a sample from this list (and some translations): "Bär" is German for "bear". "Sauer" is German for "sour." "Hoch" is German for "high". What is the German translation for "high?" What is the translation for "sour?" Therefore, "learn more about" should be the verb in place of "know" in order to make a grammatically correct sentence. <n> <n>- Also, "I" should have been replaced with "he" because the "Lab" was the only character in the sentence who needed to find out how, they were not a speaker making a statement. <n> <n>### Challenge:Create your own multiple choice sentence!<n> <n>

How should I go about doing this?<n>There are directories available online for looking up people’s phone numbers. You can search for people on google by name and where they live<n><n>Input: Something’s wrong with my pens. I tried writing a letter with them and I couldn't write legibly.<n>Check if you have any ink cartridges. If not, replace the cartridges in your printer. If you still can't write, ask for a new set of pens<n><n>Input: Science and technology are beneficial.<n>The correct answer is B.  <n>Caps are the round part of pencil that we stick in the back of the pencil.  <n>The pencils don't work because the caps are stuck inside the pencil<n><n>## The output response should be between 360 and 720 Words<n><n>### Output:<n>A: The scientist begins analysing the data which he has obtained from various researches to learn more about the objectives and goals in the lab.<n>B: To learn more about the world around him, the environment and other living organisms<n>C: Science is very beneficial to society as it helps us to learn about the universe and how nature works<n>D: Look up online directories on google/search by name and location to locate a person in the database when you need to contact someone<n>E: Replace your ink cartridges with new ones and then try writing letters. If you can’t write legibly, get a new set of pens.<n>F: Beneficial in many ways – science and technology help to improve our lives, by making our work and everyday routines easier<n><n>### The word count should be between 350 and 750 Words.

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The lab results had been compiled, the scientist began analysing the data because he wanted what? Choices:  A: learn more about B: headache C: do math D: enlightened E: better understanding<n>Answer: E: better understanding<n><n>Input: I needed to find out how to contact a person with a certain name, where should I look? Choices:  A: directory B: michigan C: roster D: phone book E: certificate<n>Answer: D: phone book<n><n>### Input:What is something you do  in a bank? Choices:  A: make noise B: have tea C: make time D: make payments E: take time<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>```javascript<n>const response = {<n>    "question" : [<n>        {<n>        "type": "multiple-choice",<n>            "options" : [<n>                "A: learn more about B",<n>                "b: headache C: Do math D: enlightend E: better understanding",<n>                "A: directory B: michighan C: roster D PPhone book E: Certifica",<n>                "what Is somethin you do in a bank, make Noise, Make tea, maky payment, take Time",<n>                "A : make noise B: have Tea C: make time D : make payment E: take time"<n>            ],<n>            "answer" : [<n>                0,<n>                1,<n>                2,<n>                3,<n>                4<n>            ],<n>            } <n>    ].question.map(element => {<n>    return `<p> ${ (element.type === "multiple-choice")? 'Multiple Answer Question' :<n>      'Multiple Choice Question' }: ${element.options.map(element =><n>      `<li> ${element.option.questionText.toLowerCase()}:<n>      ${element.option.selectedOptions.map(element=> element)}</li><n>      '${ (element.option.type === "multipleChoice")? element.subQuestionText.toLowerCase():element.questionText.toUpperCase()}<n>      </p>`).join('')}<n>      <p> ${(element.type === "singleAnswer")?  `Single Answer Question:<n>      ${element.questionText.split(' ')<n>   .join('   ').replace(/[\']| ?$/gi, "")} </p>` :  "Single Choice Question:<n>      ${(element.type && (element.type ==='singleChoice')?element.questionText.replace(/[\']+/gi, ""):element.questionText ).split(' ')<n>       .join('   ')}</p>`   } ).join('')<n>}<n>```
